alert.note: Alert for Gates of the Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 06 at 9:27PM MDT until May 08 at 12:09AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Montana... Dearborn River at Craig affecting areas near the Dearborn River as well as nearby portions of Wolf Creek and Lyons creek. .The combination of higher elevation snowmelt and recent rainfall has led to rises on the Dearborn River and Lyons creek in Lewis and Clark county. Portions of these waterways are at bankful with continued runoff expected to bring additional rises to to these waterways through Sunday. For the Dearborn River...including Craig...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Dearborn River at Craig. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, River coming out of banks within reach of USGS gage, flooding field to north of river and west of Highway 287. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:53 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tonight or early Sunday based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 700 AM MDT.
